answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found a number of cities that have social workers working with the police department. You may want to contact them directly for more information on their job descriptions.
Youth and Family Specialist Program, Arlington, VA
http://www.arlingtonpd.org/index.asp?nextpg=va.htm#team
Two Social Workers on Staff, Village of Wheeling, IL
http://vi.wheeling.il.us/services/police/default.asp
Wilmington, NC
http://www.wilmingtonnc.gov/police_department/policing_services/criminal_investigation_division/wpd_counselor.aspx
The Village of Wilmette, IL
http://www.wilmette.com/departments/police/socialservices.aspx
This is a job description for a community social worker.
http://www.maca.gov.nt.ca/school/tools/JD_docs/Community%20Social%20Worker%20%20J.pdf
This is a report about Social Work and Police Partnership which includes case studies and best practices.
http://www.ncgccd.org/pubs/SWAPP.pdf
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: James Buckley
text:
I am looking for job descriptions for Police Social Worker and I am interested in any suggestions or feedback from communities that have Social Workers working in the Police Department.  Are the Social Workers effective in working with Officer issues, helping in the field, community outreach?
Any assistance in evaluating this concept would be greatly appriciated?
Thank you.
Greg Buckley
title: Social Worker in Police Department
